wikipedia_page.main: David Mawdsley Ritchie (12 August 1892 – 10 September 1974) was an English cricketer active from 1922 to 1926 who played for Lancashire. He was born in Liverpool and died in Stevenage. He appeared in four first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who bowled right arm fast. He scored 27 runs with a highest score of 12 and held four catches. He took nine wickets with a best analysis of three for 44.

response: *David Ritchie (politician) (1812–1867), Republican member of the U.S. House of Representatives
*Black Dwarf (personage) (1740–1811), born as David Ritchie, a dwarf, the inspiration for Sir Walter Scott's novel The Black Dwarf
*David Ritchie (moderator) (1763–1844), moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland, 1814/15
